io.jenetics.prngine

Class KISS64Random

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • io.jenetics.prngine.PRNG
        • io.jenetics.prngine.Random64
          • io.jenetics.prngine.KISS64Random
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KISS64Random.ThreadSafe

    public class KISS64Random
extends Random64
    Implementation of an simple PRNG as proposed in Good Practice in (Pseudo) Random Number Generation for Bioinformatics Applications (JKISS64, page 10) by David Jones, UCL Bioinformatics Group.

    The following listing shows the actual PRNG implementation. 

    
 private long x, y = <seed>
 private int z1, c1, z2, c2 = <seed>

 long nextLong() {
     x = 0x14ADA13ED78492ADL*x + 123456789;

     y ^= y << 21;
     y ^= y >>> 17;
     y ^= y << 30;

     long t = 4294584393L*_z1 + _c1;
     c1 = (int)(t >> 32);
     z1 = (int)t;

     t = 4246477509L*z2 + c2;
     c2 = (int)(t >> 32);
     z2 = (int)t;

     return x + y + z1 + ((long)z2 << 32);
 }

    The period of this PRNG is ≈ 2250 ≈ 1.8⋅1075

    Not that the base implementation of the KISS64Random class is not thread-safe. If multiple threads requests random numbers from this class, it must be synchronized externally. Alternatively you can use the thread-safe implementations KISS64Random.ThreadSafe or KISS64Random.ThreadLocal.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  KISS64Random.ThreadLocal
      This class represents a thread local implementation of the KISS64Random PRNG.
      static class  KISS64Random.ThreadSafe
      This is a thread safe variation of the this PRNG—by synchronizing the random number generation.

      • SEED_BYTES

        public static final int SEED_BYTES
        The number of seed bytes (32) this PRNG requires.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • KISS64Random

        public KISS64Random(byte[] seed)
        Create a new not thread-safe instance of the KISS64Random engine. 
        
 final byte[] seed = KISS64Random.seedBytes();
 final Random random = new KISS64Random(seed);
        Parameters:
        seed - the random seed value. The seed must be (at least) SEED_BYTES long.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given seed is shorter than SEED_BYTES
        See Also:
        seedBytes()

      • KISS64Random

        public KISS64Random(long seed)
        Create a new not thread-safe instance of the KISS64Random engine. The constructed PRNG is equivalent with 
        
 final long seed = ...;
 final Random random = new KISS64Random();
 random.setSeed(seed);
        which is there for compatibility reasons with the Java Random engine.
        Parameters:
        seed - the random seed value

      • KISS64Random

        public KISS64Random()
        Create a new not thread-safe instance of the KISS64Random engine. The PRNG is initialized with seedBytes().

      • seedBytes

        public static byte[] seedBytes()
        Create a new seed byte array suitable for this PRNG. The returned seed array is SEED_BYTES long.
        Returns:
        a new seed byte array of length SEED_BYTES
